message: http://fluin.com It's like a cross between IM and a Forum. Posts are threaded and everything happens in realtime.
@moforce You may try to utilize Apache Wave technology to show char by char typing.
what technologies are you using?

Thanks guys! I'm using php + javascript (w/ mootools) + comet. @vega113 I thought about implementing that, and I totally could, but I'm worried about the case where there are lots of others replying at the same time. Of course adding it in could take it to the next level... hyper realtime? lol Either way I'll need to attract a solid initial user base to test different variations and whatnot.
You're doing comet with PHP?
Great job. Looks cool.
@moforce Well, the advantage of Wave technology is that it handles such issues as simultaneous edits by Operational Transformation algorithm.

@moforce By the way, when I think about it, then something similar to your site is already implemented based on Wave in a Box project and light weight mobile client that uses Data API for Wave in a Box. The Data API client doesn't support real time editing, but supports threads. Also, since it is based on Wave technology, it supports user data per each thread (like number of read/unread threads per user). Take a look at micro-box.appspot.com .
Nice find. It looks like you need to have your own wave server to test though?
I holla'd on it :)

@moforce No, not really. you need first to register account with waveinabox.net:9898 demo server. Then you can use micro-box.appspot.com to access your inbox from the light weight client. While the official Wave in a Box client is heavy and still buggy, micro-box is fast and almost bugs free (while having only a subset of the full client features).
Impressive! Very fast. How long did it take you?

@vega113 thanks, it sure is fast @taariq it's hard to say exactly how long... most of it was done within a few weeks (over my winter break before the spring semester)... since then I've just been tinkering with it.The problem is getting users since something like this requires multiple concurrent users to make it useful.
@myke thanks :D btw, how did you manage to get initial users to lissn.com?
launched at techcrunch50, then a couple techcrunch articles were most beneficial
i want more people to use fluin so i can see it in action :)
if i could offer a suggestion, make the voting buttons more button-y.  that way people want to (or know you can) click it :D
will do, thanks. Yeah, it's tough to get people on simultaneously. The only way that would happen is if it got posted on HN. Unfortunately I can't post it on HN
@moforce why not?
@hrishimittal I think I got banned from HN
